Yes, but visualization can be made through ordering of neurons by their layers. Firstly we draw neurons with "pure" 1-st level (all connections to the input one). Then (a bit further from inputs) only those neurons that have connections to the 0 and 1 layer only and so on.

And what was your method?

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Philip Tucker" <tucker0171@y...> wrote:
> We did an implementation similar to this.  We've also doen it with shortest
> distance to output layer.  For the purpose of determining a best guess at
> which links should be recurrent it has served us well.
> 
> For the purpose of determinnig a graphical layout, it's not quite as good.
> Since we're using shortest distance, nodes tend to get "pulled" toward the
> input or output layer.
>
